metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6542 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ssh_agent_channel_data function in PuTTY before 0.68 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a large length value in an agent protocol message and leveraging the ability to connect to the Unix-domain socket representing the forwarded agent connection, which trigger a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6542` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

pterm - 0.67-3build0.16.04.1
putty - 0.67-3build0.16.04.1
putty-tools - 0.67-3build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: putty package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.67-3build0.16.04.1').
